Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Group Dinner Check
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: The bill arrives at a group dinner. Everyone contributed differently to the total. What's your approach?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Overcrowded Calendar
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: You've accidentally double-booked yourself - a close friend's birthday dinner and a work networking event that could advance your career. How do you handle this?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Stranger's Story
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: At a party, someone you've just met starts telling you a deeply personal story about their struggles. How do you respond?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Lost Tourist
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: You're running late for an important meeting when a confused tourist stops you for directions. What do you do?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Mistaken Stranger
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: Someone confidently greets you like an old friend, but you have no idea who they are. How do you handle it?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Salary Discovery
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: You accidentally discover that a colleague doing the same job as you earns significantly more. What's your next move?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Generational Advice
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: An older family member gives you unsolicited life advice that contradicts your current path. How do you respond?

Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.title: The Religious Event
Block 1: Social & Interpersonal.question: A close friend invites you to an important religious ceremony that goes against your personal beliefs. What do you do?

Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.title: The Technology Meltdown
Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.question: Your computer crashes right before a major deadline, and you haven't saved your work in hours. Walk me through your reaction and recovery.

Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.title: The Unexpected Expense
Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.question: Your car needs a $1,200 repair you didn't budget for. Walk me through your thought process.

Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.title: The Traffic Jam
Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.question: You're stuck in unexpected traffic and will definitely be late to something important. Describe what goes through your mind and what you do.

Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.title: The Street Situation
Block 2: Stress & Problem-Solving.question: Walking home at night, you notice someone has been walking behind you for several blocks. How do you handle this?

Block 3: Decision-Making & Values.title: The Found Wallet
Block 3: Decision-Making & Values.question: You find a wallet with $300 cash in a parking lot. What do you do and why?

Block 3: Decision-Making & Values.title: The Weekend Off
Block 3: Decision-Making & Values.question: You have a completely free weekend with no obligations. How do you spend it?

Block 3: Decision-Making & Values.title: The Ethical Dilemma
Block 3: Decision-Making & Values.question: You witness a coworker taking credit for someone else's idea in a meeting. The person whose idea it was doesn't seem to notice. What do you do?

Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.title: The Restaurant Choice
Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.question: You're excited about trying a new restaurant, but your date suggests somewhere you've been to multiple times and found mediocre. How do you respond?

Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.title: The Customer Service Call
Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.question: You've been on hold for 45 minutes about a billing error that's clearly the company's fault. When someone finally answers, how do you handle the conversation?

Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.title: The Line Cutter
Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.question: Someone clearly cuts in front of you in a long queue. The people behind you notice but say nothing. What do you do?

Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.title: The Unequal Split
Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.question: You're working on a group project where one person is contributing significantly less than everyone else. How do you handle this?

Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.title: The Parenting Philosophy
Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.question: You observe a friend parenting in a way that conflicts with your values. Do you say something, and if so, how?

Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.title: The Lifestyle Commentary
Block 4: Conflict & Disagreement.question: A friend is making choices you believe are harmful to their health or wellbeing. How do you approach this, if at all?

Block 5: Time & Priorities.title: The Spontaneous Trip
Block 5: Time & Priorities.question: A friend calls Friday afternoon with last-minute tickets to an amazing event this weekend, but you had planned a quiet weekend to recharge. What do you do?

Block 5: Time & Priorities.title: The Friend Crisis
Block 5: Time & Priorities.question: Your best friend calls with an emergency the same night as a planned date you've been looking forward to. What's your thinking process?

Block 5: Time & Priorities.title: The Hobby Time
Block 5: Time & Priorities.question: You finally have time for a hobby you've been neglecting, but a friend asks you to help them move that same day. How do you decide?

Block 5: Time & Priorities.title: The Local vs. Chain
Block 5: Time & Priorities.question: You're choosing between a more expensive local business and a cheaper chain store for a purchase. What factors influence your decision?

Block 6: Growth & Change.title: The Learning Opportunity
Block 6: Growth & Change.question: You're offered a promotion that requires skills you don't currently have. How do you approach this opportunity?

Block 6: Growth & Change.title: The Mistake Made
Block 6: Growth & Change.question: You realize you've made a significant mistake at work that no one else has noticed yet. What do you do?

Block 6: Growth & Change.title: The Feedback Received
Block 6: Growth & Change.question: Someone you respect gives you critical feedback about a blind spot they've noticed in your behavior. How do you process and respond to this?
